title: 289. How Stupid Is Our Obsession With Lawns?
description: Nearly two percent of America is grassy green. Sure, lawns are beautiful and useful and they smell great. But are the costs — financial, environmental and otherwise — worth the benefits?
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: Nearly two percent of America is grassy green. Sure, lawns are beautiful and useful and they smell great. But are the costs — financial, environmental and otherwise — worth the benefits?
